description: The headquarters of the Franky Family, a large building where the gang of ship dismantlers live, work, and celebrate. It serves as their base of operations in Water 7.

keyEvents.title: Introduction of Franky House
keyEvents.description: The Franky House is shown for the first time as the headquarters of the Franky Family.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the base of operations for the Franky Family.

keyEvents.title: Franky Family Celebration
keyEvents.description: The Franky Family celebrates at Franky House after stealing 200 million berries from the Straw Hats.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Franky Family's party-loving nature and their disrespect for the money they stole.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Destroys the Door
keyEvents.description: Usopp arrives at Franky House and destroys the front door with his slingshot to confront the Franky Family.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of Usopp's confrontation with the Franky Family.

statusHistory.reason: Franky House is operational as the headquarters of the Franky Family

description: The largest and most prestigious shipbuilding company in Water 7, led by Iceburg. They are known for their exceptional craftsmanship and ship repair services.

keyEvents.title: Going Merry's Diagnosis
keyEvents.description: At Galley-La Company, Iceburg and the shipwrights deliver the devastating news that the Going Merry's keel is broken and cannot be repaired.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the crew learns the heartbreaking truth about their beloved ship.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Denial
keyEvents.description: Luffy refuses to accept the diagnosis at Galley-La Company, insisting there must be a way to repair the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Luffy's emotional attachment to the ship and his difficulty accepting loss.

name.japanese: ウォーターセブンの通り

description: The streets and canals of Water 7, the city of water where shipbuilding thrives. The city is built on waterways with canals running throughout.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Found Beaten
keyEvents.description: Nami finds Usopp lying beaten and injured on a Water 7 street after being attacked by the Franky Family.
keyEvents.significance: The location where Usopp's lowest moment in the arc is revealed.

keyEvents.title: Nami Learns About the Franky Family
keyEvents.description: Nami questions people on the streets and learns about the Franky Family who attacked Usopp.
keyEvents.significance: Provides crucial information about the antagonists.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel given to them by Kaya. It has been with the crew since the beginning of their journey but now faces irreparable damage.

keyEvents.title: Sanji and Chopper Return to Merry
keyEvents.description: Sanji and Chopper return to the Going Merry after failing to find Robin.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the crew's base while dealing with multiple crises.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Stolen Money
keyEvents.description: The crew discovers the 200 million berries have been stolen from the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: The ship becomes the scene of a devastating loss.

keyEvents.title: Zoro's Philosophy on Being Pirates
keyEvents.description: Zoro explains to Sanji and Chopper on the Going Merry that as pirates, they cannot rely on authorities.
keyEvents.significance: A philosophical moment about the consequences of their pirate lifestyle.

statusHistory.reason: The keel is broken and the ship has been deemed irreparable by Galley-La Company
